Question: what are statistical areas
Response: Statistical Areas (SA2, SA3, SA4) are geographical regions used for statistical analysis, representing communities with shared social and economic characteristics. SA2s are medium-sized areas with populations ranging from 3,000 to 25,000, while SA3s are larger regions made up of neighbouring SA2s, typically housing 30,000 to 130,000 people. For more detailed information, you can visit the Australian Child Atlas website [here](https://australianchildatlas.com/statistical-areas).

Question: assault
Response: To find data on assault, open the Atlas map, navigate to the right-hand side pane, and type 'assault' in the search box. If data is available, select the subcategory of interest from the drop-down options.
